namespaces.brief: thrust::cpp is a top-level alias for thrust::system::cpp.
namespaces.name: thrust::cpp
namespaces.summary: thrust::cpp is a top-level alias for thrust::system::cpp.
namespaces.title: thrust::cpp

namespaces.brief: thrust::system is the namespace which contains specific Thrust backend systems. It also contains functionality for reporting error conditions originating from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces such as the CUDA runtime. They are provided in a separate namespace for import convenience but are also aliased in the top-level thrust namespace for easy access.
namespaces.name: thrust::system
namespaces.summary: thrust::system is the namespace which contains specific Thrust backend systems. It also contains functionality for reporting error conditions originating from the operating system or other low-level application program interfaces such as the CUDA runtime. They are provided in a separate namespace for import convenience but are also aliased in the top-level thrust namespace for easy access.
namespaces.title: thrust::system

namespaces.brief: thrust::system::cuda is the namespace containing functionality for allocating, manipulating, and deallocating memory available to Thrust's CUDA backend system. The identifiers are provided in a separate namespace underneath thrust::system for import convenience but are also aliased in the top-level thrust::cuda namespace for easy access.
namespaces.name: thrust::system::cuda
namespaces.summary: thrust::system::cuda is the namespace containing functionality for allocating, manipulating, and deallocating memory available to Thrust's CUDA backend system. The identifiers are provided in a separate namespace underneath thrust::system for import convenience but are also aliased in the top-level thrust::cuda namespace for easy access.
namespaces.title: thrust::system::cuda

publicTypes.definition: using thrust::system::cpp::pointer = typedef thrust::pointer< T, thrust::system::cpp::tag, thrust::tagged_reference<T, thrust::system::cpp::tag> >
publicTypes.details: cpp::pointer stores a pointer to an object allocated in memory accessible by the cpp system. This type provides type safety when dispatching algorithms on ranges resident in cpp memory. cpp::pointer has pointer semantics: it may be dereferenced and manipulated with pointer arithmetic. cpp::pointer can be created with the function cpp::malloc, or by explicitly calling its constructor with a raw pointer. The raw pointer encapsulated by a cpp::pointer may be obtained by eiter its get member function or the raw_pointer_cast function.
publicTypes.name: pointer
note: cpp::pointer is not a "smart" pointer; it is the programmer's responsibility to deallocate memory pointed to by cpp::pointer.

templateParamsList.name: T
templateParamsList.text: specifies the type of the pointee.

publicTypes.title: pointer
publicTypes.type: thrust::pointer< T, thrust::system::cpp::tag, thrust::tagged_reference< T, thrust::system::cpp::tag > >
publicTypes.typePlain: thrust::pointer< T, thrust::system::cpp::tag, thrust::tagged_reference< T, thrust::system::cpp::tag > >

publicTypes.definition: using thrust::system::cpp::universal_pointer = typedef thrust::pointer< T, thrust::system::cpp::tag, typename std::add_lvalue_reference<T>::type >
publicTypes.details: cpp::universal_pointer stores a pointer to an object allocated in memory accessible by the cpp system and host systems. cpp::universal_pointer has pointer semantics: it may be dereferenced and manipulated with pointer arithmetic. cpp::universal_pointer can be created with cpp::universal_allocator or by explicitly calling its constructor with a raw pointer. The raw pointer encapsulated by a cpp::universal_pointer may be obtained by eiter its get member function or the raw_pointer_cast function.
publicTypes.name: universal_pointer
note: cpp::universal_pointer is not a "smart" pointer; it is the programmer's responsibility to deallocate memory pointed to by cpp::universal_pointer.

templateParamsList.name: T
templateParamsList.text: specifies the type of the pointee.

publicTypes.title: universal_pointer
publicTypes.type: thrust::pointer< T, thrust::system::cpp::tag, typename std::add_lvalue_reference< T >::type >
publicTypes.typePlain: thrust::pointer< T, thrust::system::cpp::tag, typename std::add_lvalue_reference< T >::type >

publicTypes.details: reference is a wrapped reference to an object stored in memory available to the cpp system. reference is the type of the result of dereferencing a cpp::pointer.
publicTypes.name: reference

templateParamsList.name: T
templateParamsList.text: Specifies the type of the referenced object.

publicTypes.title: reference

The raw pointer encapsulated by a omp::pointer may be obtained by eiter its get member function or the raw_pointer_cast function.

The raw pointer encapsulated by a tbb::pointer may be obtained by eiter its get member function or the raw_pointer_cast function.
